abstract: English soccer team Swindon Town FC goes to unusual lengths to control and tailor its coverage in media; began strictly limiting access for reporters, photographers and videographers when owner became displeased with local newspaper's coverage of legal battle for team's ownership; some American professional and college teams have taken steps to control their portrayal in media but Swindon's move is notable because it is a third-division club with a small following.
lead_paragraph: In a move that reflects a shifting media landscape, Swindon Town F.C. has largely barred reporters from interviewing players and coaches, and it plans to provide its own content.

headline.main: English Club Shuts Out Journalists With New Kind of Defense
headline.print_headline: Shutting Out Journalists With a New Kind of Defense

snippet: In a move that reflects a shifting media landscape, Swindon Town F.C. has largely barred reporters from interviewing players and coaches, and it plans to provide its own content.
